alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 8:57PM EDT until July 17 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN CABELL, NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHWESTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 857 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. According to Emergency Management, flash flooding was already occurring in Teays Valley along Route 34 just north of interstate 64, and along Mount Vernon Road, just south of the interstate. The heaviest of the rain was over, and these flood waters should begin to recede by 10 pm. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hamlin, Hurricane, Culloden, Teays Valley, West Hamlin, Sweetland, Myra, Salt Rock and Branchland. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
